meanings.definition: A window sash that opens on hinges along one side.
meanings.sent1: The casements in the old house creaked when they were opened.
meanings.sent2: I love to open the casements in my bedroom to let in the fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to sneak out through the casements but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the golden light streamed through the casements, painting the room in warm hues.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain tapping against the closed casements was soothing.

meanings.sent1: The castle had beautiful casements overlooking the lush gardens.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the casements in the historic building.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the casements, chirping happily in the morning.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were drawn to the casements, framing a picturesque view of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight filtered through the delicate casements, casting a soft glow in the room.
